text: Judgement Day (also known as The Third Hand) is a 1988 American horror film written and directed by Ferde Grofé Jr. and starring Ken McLeod, David Anthony Smith, Monte Markham, Peter Mark Richman, and Cesar Romero. Judgment Day was Romero's last film appearance to be released in his lifetime. His next film appearance, The Right Way, would occur in 1998, four years after his death. ==Plot== Charlie and Pete, two American backpackers in Mexico, make their way to the town of Santana after their bus breaks down. There, a fellow American named Sam, who bartends at a local restaurant, warns them that the townspeople will all leave the area before sundown. This is because the town was cursed by the devil, who, for one night per year, gets to take over the village with his legion of demons and capture any humans who remain present, sending them to eternal torture in hell. ==Cast== * Ken McLeod as Charlie * David Anthony Smith as Pete * Monte Markham as Sam * Peter Mark Richman as Priest * Cesar Romero as Octavio ==Production== The film was shot in the Philippines. ==References== ==External links== * * Category:English-language films Category:American supernatural horror films Category:American films Category:Demons in film Category:Films directed by Ferde Grofé Jr. Category:1988 horror films
